replies.text: Bro you can do it. I‚Äôm all diy and I‚Äôm at the point if I know what wrong with the car I can fix it without a video, done things as simple as replacing a serpentine belt all the way to pulling and installing motors took me a while and a lot of YouTube to get there. But trust me interior is not hard, just annoying and tedious, take your time, get trim tools, steering wheel puller be overly careful. You got it.
replies.author: @yessuhyessuh2100

topLevelComment.text:
Where does the other end of the small white plug from the digital cluster, plug into?
Also where does the usb plug coming from the digital cluster plug into?
topLevelComment.author: @orondedd

replies.text:
The two plugs go directly into the new cluster. It has two inputs for them. Big and small white cables go into the cluster.
The USB coming out of the cluster just hangs somewhere where you can access it to update the cluster when needed via a USB thumbdrive.
replies.author: @mfl8276

topLevelComment.text:
How well do hands-free calls work when listening to music via wireless CarPlay? Any issues with Bluetooth? Is the audio digital for hands-free calls while playing music? I upgraded the radio in my Q60 to enable CarPlay, and for hands-free calls, I had to connect it via an aux cable or a USB-to-aux converter. The audio quality for calls was terrible, so I don‚Äôt use this function.

I‚Äôm asking this because if everything works well, I‚Äôd like to purchase it in the future to integrate more functions, such as including the EcuTek dashboard.
topLevelComment.author: @h4nztube

replies.text: You'd use OEM bluetooth for hands-free calls

topLevelComment.text: Wait, so you have to continuously update the MK7 for  it to work
topLevelComment.author: @slenderman6927

replies.text: It works out of the box.  But it has periodic optional updates that add features and improve performance.  Kinda like most electronics that have come out post-Y2K.
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto

topLevelComment.text: If Im having issues with the guages on my cluster being wonky sometimes, would the APEX help with that?
topLevelComment.author: @Tophsta

replies.text: Depends on the root cause.  If its busted hardware (needle motor going bad or something), the APEX will help.  If your car is sending wonky signals sometimes, APEX will show them too.
replies.author: @SquareWheelsAuto
